explanation:
- struct DigestAlgorithm / its fields (uninitialised, algo_selected, algo): needed to know the types, valid ranges and invariants of the members accessed (pointer dereference safety, whether algo can hold values outside the tested constants, and whether those fields can be trusted to prevent erroneous sizes).
- MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5, MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256, MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256: the algorithm identifiers tested against da->algo; their exact values and enum/type are required to determine which branch can be taken and whether any undocumented values exist that could cause unexpected behavior.
- MD5_DIGEST_SIZE, SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE, SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE: the numeric sizes returned by this function; to check MISRA string-bound violations you must know the exact sizes that callers will receive and subsequently pass to string.h functions (e.g., memcpy, strlen-related uses).
- mhd_assert: its definition/behavior (compile-time removal, side effects, aborting behavior) is required to know whether assert calls can be optimized away and whether the final compiled function can fall through to the mhd_assert(0) path or return 0; this affects whether callers might receive an unexpected size (or zero) and thus whether downstream string operations could access out-of-bounds.
- MHD_MD5_SUPPORT, MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT, MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT: feature macros control which if-branches are emitted; to analyze actual compiled behavior (and resulting available sizes), you must know which of these are defined in the build configuration.
